title: Safe Word: Omega Debuts a New Watch With Ashley Graham, Tems, and Ariana DeBose
excerpt: Read our roundup of the best jewelry news, launches, and happenings this month to stay up to date on all things sparkly.
text: Omega Debuts the Aqua Terra WatchCourtesy of OmegaWith the help of six notable women, including model Ashley Graham, Academy Award-winning performer Ariana DeBose, and Grammy-winning singer-songwriter Tems, among others, Omega unveiled a new watch style, the 30mm Aqua Terra. Available in 12 styles, the new design features a reimagined movement for the smaller scale, created for versatility and wearability. With dials in various shades and materials—like 18K Moonshine™ Gold, 18K Sedna™ Gold, stainless steel, and two-tone variations—the timepiece is meant to be a personal statement, subtle and sophisticated, for women on-the-go no matter when, where, or what time it is.Mejuri Debuts the Found Objects CollectionCourtesy of MejuriIf you needed proof that Sardine Girl Summer is here, look no further. Mejuri just released a capsule collection of seaside, beach-ready jewelry inspired by all things summer, from shells and tinned sardines to match sticks and bottle caps. Priced between $68 and $98, the Found Objects collection is a lesson in summer nostalgia and adventured souvenirs and is shoppable now, just in time for the official start of summer.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowLouis Vuitton Adds New Styles to Its Vivienne CollectionCourtesy of Louis VuittonLouis Vuitton has unveiled new additions to its Vivienne collection, perfectly timed for a whimsical summer escape. In case you’re not familiar, Vivienne, the beloved mascot of the house, embodies its signature blend of playful charm, expert craftsmanship, and timeless elegance.Van Cleef & Arpels Sponsors New Planetarium Space ShowCourtesy of Jon Parker/American Museum of Natural HistoryAs part of its ongoing partnership with the American Museum of Natural History (AMNH), Van Cleef & Arpels is sponsoring a space show at the Hayden Planetarium: “Encounters in the Milky Way,” narrated by none other than Pedro Pascal. Premiering on June 9, this immersive experience celebrates the 25th anniversary of the museum’s Rose Center for Earth and Space, and draws on groundbreaking astronomical discoveries from the past century with academic contributions from more than 20 leading institutions.
html:
Omega Debuts the Aqua Terra Watch

With the help of six notable women, including model Ashley Graham, Academy Award-winning performer Ariana DeBose, and Grammy-winning singer-songwriter Tems, among others, Omega unveiled a new watch style, the 30mm Aqua Terra. Available in 12 styles, the new design features a reimagined movement for the smaller scale, created for versatility and wearability. With dials in various shades and materials—like 18K Moonshine™ Gold, 18K Sedna™ Gold, stainless steel, and two-tone variations—the timepiece is meant to be a personal statement, subtle and sophisticated, for women on-the-go no matter when, where, or what time it is.

Mejuri Debuts the Found Objects Collection

If you needed proof that Sardine Girl Summer is here, look no further. Mejuri just released a capsule collection of seaside, beach-ready jewelry inspired by all things summer, from shells and tinned sardines to match sticks and bottle caps. Priced between $68 and $98, the Found Objects collection is a lesson in summer nostalgia and adventured souvenirs and is shoppable now, just in time for the official start of summer.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Louis Vuitton Adds New Styles to Its Vivienne Collection

Louis Vuitton has unveiled new additions to its Vivienne collection, perfectly timed for a whimsical summer escape. In case you’re not familiar, Vivienne, the beloved mascot of the house, embodies its signature blend of playful charm, expert craftsmanship, and timeless elegance.

Van Cleef & Arpels Sponsors New Planetarium Space Show

As part of its ongoing partnership with the American Museum of Natural History (AMNH), Van Cleef & Arpels is sponsoring a space show at the Hayden Planetarium: “Encounters in the Milky Way,” narrated by none other than Pedro Pascal. Premiering on June 9, this immersive experience celebrates the 25th anniversary of the museum’s Rose Center for Earth and Space, and draws on groundbreaking astronomical discoveries from the past century with academic contributions from more than 20 leading institutions.
